result.execSummary:
The defendant Asdrubal O Tovar Mendez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge 

**Pursuant to the Court of Appeal decision in State v. Edward, 2015 WI 51, 363 Wis.2d 628 and State v. Radaj, 2015 WI 50, 363 Wis.2d 633, and 973.13, Stats., the JOC is amended to remove the DNA surcharge(s).  Government entities shall, to the extent legally obligated to do so, comply with the courts Order to Amend Judgment of Conviction Re: DNA Surcharge(s) entered herein.**

--Mr. Tovar is to turn over any personally identifying information belonging to Mario Esparza, and documents/items that contains Mario Esparza's name or other identifying information, to the Department of Corrections within twenty days 
--no direct or indirect contact with Mario Esparza
--Mr. Tovar is not to hold any employment or volunteer position which requires him to handle or account for money
--to undergo any assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as authorized by and directed by the Agent

Arresting Agency:  JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Criminal Case Settlement

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 9:10am. 
Defendant Asdrubal O Tovar Mendez in court with Attorney Erik I. Colque.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter.

ADA Beck files an Amended Information. 
The charges and maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1 and Count #2; the factual basis is recited by Attorney Colque; victim rights compliance verified (the victim is not present; the victim impact statement is submitted; ADA Beck indicates that the victim is not requesting restitution); the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Tovar guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Counts #1 & #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Tovar on Probation for two years, with conditions:

--Mr. Tovar is to turn over any personally identifying information belonging to Mario Esparza, and documents/items that contains Mario Esparza's name or other identifying information, to the Department of Corrections within twenty days 
--no direct or indirect contact with Mario Esparza
--Mr. Tovar is not to hold any employment or volunteer position which requires him to handle or account for money
--to undergo any assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as authorized by and directed by the Agent
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge on Count #1
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge on Count #2


Days credit for time already served: 0 days
The Court indicates that if the DNA surcharge is found to be unconstitutional, and the Defendant has not yet paid the surcharge, then the Judgment of Conviction is to be amended to remove the surcharge payment requirement.  If the DNA surcharge has been paid and the ruling that found the DNA surcharge unconstitutional directs the clerks to reimburse the amount paid, then the clerk is to refund the amount paid to the Defendant. If the reimbursement is not mandated, then the amount will be kept.
Contact prohibition warnings/penalites given.
recess 9:29am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.
State's
State's
of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant
Jury trial on October 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on October 3, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

case called at 10:08am. 
Defendant Asdrubal O Tovar Mendez in court with Attorney Erik I. Colque.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court indicates to Interpreter Shawna Stevenoski that she remains under the interpreter-oath given earlier today. 
Attorney Colque indicates that no resolution has been reached in this case, and the case should be set for trial. 
Counsel agree that the trial should be scheduled for a two-day length. 
Mr. Tovar verifies that the Kincaid Lane, Palmyra address remains current. 
recess 10:10am.

Scheduling Notice

Case called at 1:29 pm
Defendant Asdrubal O Tovar Mendez in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. ADA Theresa Ann Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Shawna Stevenoski sworn in as Spanish Interpreter.
Attorney De La Rosa informs the Court that the Defendant's eligibility for SPD representation will depend on bond.
Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1 & #2.
Court charges clerk with obtaining the fingerprint card for the file from JCSD.
The Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No direct or indirect contact with Mario Esparza, Lauren Cravens
-Not to possess any person identifying information that is not in his name

Attorney De La Rosa informs the Court that the defendant will qualify for SPD representation
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:38 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 4/16/14 at 1:40 pm
Preliminary Hearing: to be set
